**Validation against the 15 rules:**

| Rule | Check | Status |
|------|-------|--------|
| 1 | Muted palette only | Pass — all hex values are muted blues/teals/grays/gold |
| 2 | Exactly one highlight | Pass — China in `#C74634` is the sole accent |

| 4 | Consistent category→color map | Pass — explicit mapping provided |

| 7 | Sans-serif font | Pass — Inter/Helvetica/Arial |
| 8 | Direct data labels (≤8 values) | Pass — 5 bars, each labeled |
| 9 | Bar y-axis starts at 0 | Pass — `y_min: 0` |
| 10 | No top/right spines | Pass — both `false` |
| 11 | Subtle gridlines | Pass — `#D0D0D0` dashed |
| 12 | No redundant labels | Pass — unit shown once in subtitle |
| 13 | Key insight annotated | Pass — "Gap: $7.5T — the US leads China by 42%" |
| 14 | Legend for ≤3 categories | Pass — `null` legend, direct labels instead |
| 15 | Aspect ratio | Pass — 800×500, wider than tall |

**Design notes:**
- Data sorted descending by GDP so the visual ranking is immediate
- China highlighted in accent red to draw the eye to the US–China comparison
- The annotation with a bracket/callout between the USA and China bars would visually emphasize the $7.5T gap
